topic.title: GPIO Command

body.p: MRPC Command ID: 0x02
The GPIO commands are used to retrieve logical GPIO configuration, get or set pin values, and handle interrupts for GPIO pins that are configured as interrupts.

row.entry: TWI Master Transaction Timeout and Bus Recovery Success
TWI Master Transaction Timeout and Bus Recovery Fail
Failed Recovery After Slave Address Set Failure
Master Activity During Slave Address Set Attempt

body.p: The following sub-commands are available for the GPIO command.

entry.p: Enable Interrupt for a GPIO Pin
Disable Interrupt for a GPIO Pin
Get all pins' status if get an event notification message

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Get Direction Configuration Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to get the direction of a specified GPIO.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Direction Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Direction Configuration operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Direction Output Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the Get Direction Configuration operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
This field indicates the direction of this GPIO:
0 - Output
1 - Input
2 - Bi-Directional

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Get Polarity Configuration Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to get the polarity of a specified GPIO.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Polarity Configuration Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the Get Polarity Configuration operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Polarity Configuration Output Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the Get Polarity Configuration operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
This field indicates if the polarity is inverted for this GPIO:
0 - Polarity not inverted
1 - Polarity inverted

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Get Pin Value Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to get the value of a specified GPIO.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Pin Value Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x2 for the Get Pin Value operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.

table.title: GPIO Command Get Pin Value Output Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x2 for the Get Pin Value operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
This field indicates the value of this GPIO pin.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Set Pin Value Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to set the value of a specified GPIO.

table.title: GPIO Command Set Pin Value Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x3 for the Set Pin Value operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
This field indicates the value to set for this GPIO pin.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Enable GPIO Interrupt Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to enable GPIO interrupts for a specified GPIO. When interrupts are enabled for a GPIO, a global event message will be sent out when that GPIO's value changes.

table.title: GPIO Command Enable GPIO Interrupt Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x4 for the Enable GPIO Interrupt operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Disable GPIO Interrupt Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to disable GPIO interrupts for a specified GPIO.

table.title: GPIO Command Disable GPIO Interrupt Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x5 for the Disable GPIO Interrupt operation.
This field specifies the logical GPIO index. This value can be found in the "GPIO Binding Instance #" column of the Adapter Pins table in the configuration file.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: GPIO Ì¶ Get GPIO Pin Status Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command is used to get all GPIO pin values. This command can be used to check all GPIO values after receiving a global event message indicating a GPIO interrupt. The switch firmware will only issue one GPIO interrupt message until this command is issued.

table.title: GPIO Command Get GPIO Pin Status Input Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x7 for the Get GPIO Pin Status operation.

table.title: GPIO Command Get GPIO Pin Status Output Data

body.p: Specifies the GPIO Sub-Command. Set to 0x7 for the Get GPIO Pin Status operation.
The total GPIO pin number. There is a maximum of 960 GPIO pins.

This field spans up to 30 dwords and contains one bit per GPIO pins, up to a maximum of 960 GPIOs. Each bit in the field contains the value of the corresponding GPIO pin's value. The "Pin Number" field defines the number of valid bits in this field.
